message.content: This question is based on the understanding of air pollution and its impact on visibility. When there are more factories and cars releasing gas (pollutants) into the air, the air quality decreases, leading to increased levels of pollution and haze. As a result, it becomes harder to go stargazing because the pollutants in the air cause reduced visibility, obscuring the view of the stars. Options (A), (B), and (D) are unrelated to air pollution and not affected by the presence of gas in the air.

This question requires an understanding of air pollution and its effects on visibility. When there are more factories and cars releasing gas into the air, the air quality deteriorates. This can lead to increased air pollution, which can make it harder to see stars and engage in stargazing activities. Options (A), (B), and (D) are unrelated to air pollution or visibility.

This question requires basic knowledge about air pollution and its effects on visibility. When there are more factories and cars releasing gas into the air, air pollution increases. This can make it difficult to see stars in the night sky, thus making it harder to go stargazing. Option (A) is not related to air pollution. Option (B) is not a coherent phrase and does not relate to the topic. Option (D) is unrelated and does not relate to the effects of air pollution on stargazing.
